meaningMnemonic: Something is <kanji>reverse</kanji>, that much you know. The さま comes from 様, which could mean <kanji>manner</kanji>. So, something that is in a "reverse manner," is something that is <vocabulary>upside down</vocabulary>.
readingMnemonic: The reading comes from 逆らう and 様, put together. A bit of an <vocabulary>upside down</vocabulary> reading if I do say so myself, but you do what you gotta do.
